properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 10:36AM CST until February 9 at 10:09PM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...

Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County

.The Duck River at Centerville is continuing to fall and is just above flood
stage. The River should continue to fall and should be below flood stage late
this afternoon. However, late evening, overnight, and into the first half of
the work week additional rainfall is expected which could cause additional
rises on the Duck River.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Duck River At Centerville
* Until 02/09 22:09.
* At 10AM Sunday the stage was 23.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Action stage is 17.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
* The river has crested and will fall to below flood stage late this afternoon.
* At 25.0 feet...Flood waters cover the soccer fields and bottomland along the
river. Hickman Springs Road, Defeated Creek Road, and Leatherwood Road will be
impassable. Defeated Creek will flood due to backwater from the Duck River.
* At 22.0 feet...Flood waters will cover the flood plain along the river.
Several roads near the river will be partially covered. In Centerville,
Hickman Springs Road and Defeated Creek Road will be affected. Leatherwood
Road between Shady Grove and Primm Springs near Tottys Bend will also be
affected.
* At 17.0 feet...Water begins to overflow the banks.
properties.instruction:
Avoid flooded areas along the river...And move personal belongings to higher
ground. Never drive through flooded roads as the depth of water may be too
great to pass...Even in trucks or sport utility vehicles. If you come across
a flooded road...Turn around don't drown.

Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further information
from the National Weather Service.
